alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 23 at 2:24AM MDT until April 23 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL OF EASTERN NM AND THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strong west to northwest winds with low humidity and an unstable airmass will lead to another round of critical fire weather today over all of eastern New Mexico. The greatest threat for critical fire weather over north central New Mexico will be mainly confined to the Rio Grande Valley and nearby mid slope areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 8 PM MDT this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...North Central Mountains late this morning through early this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible today. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
